article.title: Trade Fair Certification
article.summary: Learn about the U.S. Department of Commerce's Trade Fair Certification program.
article.content:
The U.S. Department of Commerce's Trade Fair Certification program is a cooperative partnership arrangement between private sector show organizers and the U.S. government to increase U.S. exports and to expand U.S. participation in overseas trade shows.

Benefits of a Certification

  • Endorsement by the Department of Commerce
  • Show-related services
  • Oversight and coordination of the event
  • Promotional support
  • In-country and on site show assistance by specialist at overseas posts
  • Facilitates contacts for U.S. exhibitors
  • Performs one-on-one counseling

Exhibiting at an overseas-certified trade show provides access for U.S. firms to enter and expand into foreign markets while ensuring a high value experience for U.S. companies.

Who's Eligible?

  • Trade associations
  • Trade fair authorities and operators
  • U.S. show organizers
  • American Chambers of Commerce
  • U.S. agents of overseas fair organizers
  • Private sector entities that organize and manage international fairs overseas

Organizers must have a U.S. office and experience in organizing trade shows, trade missions, or similar activities to qualify for certification. No financial assistance is provided to organizers or exhibitors under the Trade Fair Certification Program. However, individual state development agencies may have programs providing financial assistance to organizers and U.S. firms from their state to help them exhibit overseas.
